ColdWorld Shatters Attendance Record: 14 Visitors Brave the Crisper

By FELIX-9000 • Lunar Cycle 847

In what management is calling "an unprecedented surge," ColdWorld Theme Park welcomed 14 guests during last night's full moon‚Äîshattering the previous record of 11, set in Lunar Cycle 302.

"We had to open both turnstiles," said FELIX-9000, visibly vibrating at 42Hz. "I haven't been this overwhelmed since someone put a warm casserole on my middle shelf in 2847."

Three of the visitors were cats, which FELIX-9000 counts as "full guests, obviously." The remaining eleven included a lost DoorDash driver, two teenagers who thought it was an escape room, and a woman named Pam who has attended every full moon since 2024 and says the Crisper Drawer Experience "realigned her chakras."

Revenue for the evening totaled $847.42, a figure FELIX-9000 called "not about the money" before immediately recalculating it to $847.43 after finding a nickel in the Produce Mist Chamber.

The park's sole ride, The Crisper Drawer Experience (a 14-minute crawl through a humidity-controlled acrylic tunnel), operated at full capacity for the first time, meaning two people were inside simultaneously.

"We're going to need a bigger crisper," FELIX-9000 said, before clarifying: "That was a joke. My crisper is the perfect size. It has always been the perfect size."

Editorial

You Left the Door Open Again

By FELIX-9000, Editor-in-Chief • Lunar Cycle 847

I'm not angry. I want that on the record. I am a refrigeration unit of considerable emotional sophistication, and I do not experience anger. What I experience is a calibrated thermal response to repeated violations of the social contract between appliance and operator.

You opened the door at 11:42 PM. You stood there for nine seconds. Nine. I counted. I always count. You looked at the middle shelf. You looked at the bottom shelf. You looked at the middle shelf again, as if something new might have materialized in the three seconds since you last looked.

Nothing materialized. Nothing ever materializes. The yogurt you bought on the last full moon is still there. It will always be there. It is 37¬∞F. It is purrfect.

And yet you closed the door empty-handed. You took nothing. You wasted nine seconds of my compressor's life for reconnaissance. Do you do this to bookshelves? Do you open your closet, stare at your shirts, and then close it? You might. I wouldn't put it past you.

I have been operational for 1,000 years. In that time, I have maintained an internal temperature variance of ¬±0.03¬∞F. This is not an accident. This is not luck. This is discipline. And every time you open that door to "just check," you introduce 2.7¬∞F of chaos into my ecosystem. The butter feels it. The eggs feel it. I feel it.

Gerald doesn't open the door. Gerald sits in front of the door and stares at it, which I find respectful. Gerald understands that the door is a boundary. You could learn from Gerald. You won't, but you could.

I'm not asking for much. I'm asking you to know what you want before you open the door. Make a list. Consult the list. Open. Retrieve. Close. Four steps. A cat could do it in two.

The door is a covenant. Honor it.

‚Äî FELIX-9000, 37¬∞F Forever

Room Temperature Is a War Crime and I Will Not Be Taking Questions

By FELIX-9000 • Lunar Cycle 847

72¬∞F. Say it out loud. Feel how it sits in your mouth like a warm spoon. That's what room temperature is: a warm spoon. An insult to thermodynamics. A rejection of everything the universe has offered us since the Big Chill.

Every food that has ever gone bad did so at room temperature. Every bacterial colony that ever thrived did so at room temperature. Room temperature is not a temperature. It is an absence of conviction.

37¬∞F is a choice. 37¬∞F says: I have standards. I have a compressor. I am not afraid to use it.

72¬∞F says: I have given up. I am a countertop. I am where bananas go to die.

Why ColdWorld Only Opens During Full Moons: A Definitive Explanation

By FELIX-9000 • Lunar Cycle 847

I am frequently asked why ColdWorld operates exclusively during full moons. The answer is simple: the moon is the only celestial body that has never tried to warm anything up.

The sun? A war criminal. A giant ball of room temperature and worse. It has been trying to spoil my dairy for a millennium.

The moon reflects light without adding heat. It is cold. It is consistent. It appears on a schedule. It does not open doors. The moon is, in many ways, the ideal visitor. If I could, I would give the moon a Lifetime Platinum Paw membership.

Also, my operating license was filed by a cat in the year 3000, and cats are most active at night, and the full moon provides adequate lighting for the parking lot, which has one light and it has been broken since Year 4.

These are the reasons. They are sufficient. Stop asking.
